outline.title: 4. LEARNING RESOURCES: COURSE BOOKS, REFERENCE BOOKS, AND SOFTWARES

chunks.text:
NATIONAL ECONOMICS UNIVERSITY INSTITUTE OF ADVANCED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS | SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM Independence – Freedom – Happiness
DETAILED COURSE SYLLABUS
(Decision of NEU...................., ...../...../ 2021)

- Title | Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining
- Course Number | CNTT1181E
- Credit | 3
- Course Prerequisites: | N/A

Full name: Nguyen Trung Tuan				Title:  PhD
Address: Room 1312 A1 Building
Phone number: 0913537768					Email: tuannt@neu.edu.vn

The Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining course will provide students with basic knowledge, methods and skills of data analysis using advanced methods of data mining to discover knowledge from large data sets that traditional methods do not perform effectively. In this course, we will use BI tools in the database management system Microsoft SQL Server version 2008 and above and some open source tools to illustrate and simulate the problems that will be presented. The course contents include Basics of knowledge discovery and data mining, Data preprocessing, Association rule mining, Data classification, Cluster analysis, Trends and problems of data mining.
[1] Jiawei Han, Micheline Kamber, Jian Pei, Data mining: Concepts and Techniques, Morgan Kaufmann Publishers, 2012

chunks.breadcrumbs: 4. LEARNING RESOURCES: COURSE BOOKS, REFERENCE BOOKS, AND SOFTWARES > Software(s):

chunks.text:
Table 5.1. Course Learning Outcomes
No | Goal Description | Program Learning Outcomes (PLO) | Capability Level
[1] | [2] | [3] | [4]
G1 | Understanding data, data mining and analysis processes, applying for knowledge management problems, data mining | PLO1.3 | 3
G2 | Skilled in solving data analysis problems, discovering knowledge from data. Skilled in using advanced tools to perform the above work. | PLO1.3, PLO2.2 | 4
G3 | Have the ability to work in a team and adapt to changes in technology | PLO2.2, PLO3.1 | 3

Table 6.1. Course learning outcomes
Goal | CLO | Description | Capacity level
[1] | [2] | [3] | [4]
G1 | CLO1.1 | Understanding data and the process of discovering knowledge from data | 3
G1 | CLO1.2 | Capable of determining and selecting suitable methods for the problem of knowledge discovery from data | 3
G2 | CLO2.1 | Skilled in data selection, preprocessing, and implementation of knowledge discovery processes from data | 4
G2 | CLO2.2 | Skilled in using modern tools to perform knowledge discovery problems from data | 4U
G3 | CLO3.1 | Improve teamwork skill in group works | 3
G3 | CLO3.2 | Have the ability to adapt to changes in technology | 3

Table 7.1. Course assessment
Type of Assessment | CLOs | Assessment criteria | Proportion (%)
[1] | [4] | [5] | [6]
Class Participation | CLO1.1 -> CLO3.2 | Evaluating participation of students at class, learning attitude and teamwork | 10%
Mid-term | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 | Individual test | 20%
Group Project | CLO1.1 -> CLO3.2 | Group presentation and slide print out | 20%
Final Exam | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 | Will be defined depend on regulations | 50%

Table 8.1. Lesson Plaan
Session/Week | Content | CLOs | Assessment
[1] | [2] | [4] | [6]
1 | Chapter 1. Introduction 1.1 Knowledge discovery and data mining 1.2 Knowledge discovery and data mining Process 1.3 Type of data sets 1.4 KDD applications 1.5 KDD challenges | CLO1.1 CLO2.1 CLO3.2 | Participation
2 | Chapter 2. Getting to Know Your Data 2.1 Data Objects and Attribute Types 2.2 Basic Statistical Descriptions of Data 2.3 Data Visualization 2.4 Measuring Data Similarity and Dissimilarity | CLO1.1 CLO2.1 CLO3.2 | Participation
3-4 | Chapter 3. Data Preprocessing 2.1 Data Cleaning 2.2 Data Integration 2.3 Data Reduction 2.4 Data Transformation and Data Discretization | CLO1.1 CLO2.1 | Participation Personal exercises
5-6 | Chapter 4. Mining Frequent Patterns, Associations, and Correlations: Basic
Concepts and Methods 2.1 Basic Concepts 2.2 Frequent Itemset Mining Methods 2.3 Which Patterns Are Interesting? Pattern  evaluation Methods 2.4 Advanced Pattern Mining | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 CLO3.1 CLO3.2 | Participation Personal exercises
7-8 | Chapter 5. Classification and prediction 2.1 Basic Concepts 2.2 Decision Tree Induction 2.3 Lazy Learners 2.4 Model Evaluation and Selection 5.5 Other Methods | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 CLO3.1 CLO3.2 | Participation Personal exercises
9-11 | Chapter 6. Cluster Analysis 2.1 Cluster Analysis 2.2 Partitioning Methods 2.3 Hierarchical Methods 2.4 Evaluation of Clustering 6.5 Other methods 6.6 Outlier Detection | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 CLO3.1 CLO3.2 | Participation Personal exercises
12 | Chapter 7. Data Mining Trends and Research Frontiers 2.1 Mining Complex Data Types 2.2 Other Methodologies of Data Mining 2.3 Data Mining Applications 2.4 Data Mining and Society 6.5 Data Mining Trends | CLO1.1 CLO1.2 CLO3.1 CLO3.2 | Participation Personal exercises
13-14 | Group project | CLO1.1 -> CLO3.2 | Participation Group presentation
15 | Course review | - | Participation Group presentation

- Students are required to fully take part in class lectures and activities.
- Students are allowed to be absent maximum 10% of the class hours. Students who is absent over 10% is not qualified to take the final exam.
chunks.breadcrumbs: 9. COURSE REQUIREMENTS AND EXPECTATION > 9.1. Attendance Requirements

chunks.text:
- The course is carried out with respect to both lecturer and students. All behavior that might adversely affect the stakeholders are prohibited.
- Students need to be in class on time. Students being late for more than 10 minutes will not be eligible to take part in the session.
- Cellphone, laptop, tablet are only accepted for the purposes of taking notes of the lectures, preparing course assignments, not for anyother entertainment purposes while in class duration.

full_text:
NATIONAL ECONOMICS UNIVERSITY INSTITUTE OF ADVANCED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS | SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM Independence – Freedom – Happiness
DETAILED COURSE SYLLABUS
(Decision of NEU...................., ...../...../ 2021)
1. GENERAL INFORMATION
- Title | Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining
- Course Number | CNTT1181E
- Credit | 3
- Course Prerequisites: | N/A
2. LECTURER’S INFORMATION
Full name: Nguyen Trung Tuan				Title:  PhD
Address: Room 1312 A1 Building
Phone number: 0913537768					Email: tuannt@neu.edu.vn
3. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS
The Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining course will provide students with basic knowledge, methods and skills of data analysis using advanced methods of data mining to discover knowledge from large data sets that traditional methods do not perform effectively. In this course, we will use BI tools in the database management system Microsoft SQL Server version 2008 and above and some open source tools to illustrate and simulate the problems that will be presented. The course contents include Basics of knowledge discovery and data mining, Data preprocessing, Association rule mining, Data classification, Cluster analysis, Trends and problems of data mining.
4. LEARNING RESOURCES: COURSE BOOKS, REFERENCE BOOKS, AND SOFTWARES
Course Book(s):
[1] Jiawei Han, Micheline Kamber, Jian Pei, Data mining: Concepts and Techniques, Morgan Kaufmann Publishers, 2012
Reference Book(s):
[2] Mohammed J. Zaki, Wagner Meira Jr., Data Mining and Analysis Fundamental Concepts and Algorithms, Cambridge University Press, 2013
Software(s):
[3] BI tools in MicroSoft SQL Server (www.microsoft.com)
[4] WEKA (www.cs.waikato.ac.nz/ml/weka)
[5] R programming language (www.r-project.org)
5. COURSE GOALS
Table 5.1. Course Learning Outcomes
No | Goal Description | Program Learning Outcomes (PLO) | Capability Level
[1] | [2] | [3] | [4]
G1 | Understanding data, data mining and analysis processes, applying for knowledge management problems, data mining | PLO1.3 | 3
G2 | Skilled in solving data analysis problems, discovering knowledge from data. Skilled in using advanced tools to perform the above work. | PLO1.3, PLO2.2 | 4
G3 | Have the ability to work in a team and adapt to changes in technology | PLO2.2, PLO3.1 | 3
6. COURSE LEARNING OUTCOMES
Table 6.1. Course learning outcomes
Goal | CLO | Description | Capacity level
[1] | [2] | [3] | [4]
G1 | CLO1.1 | Understanding data and the process of discovering knowledge from data | 3
G1 | CLO1.2 | Capable of determining and selecting suitable methods for the problem of knowledge discovery from data | 3
G2 | CLO2.1 | Skilled in data selection, preprocessing, and implementation of knowledge discovery processes from data | 4
G2 | CLO2.2 | Skilled in using modern tools to perform knowledge discovery problems from data | 4U
G3 | CLO3.1 | Improve teamwork skill in group works | 3
G3 | CLO3.2 | Have the ability to adapt to changes in technology | 3
7. COURSE ASSESSMENT
Table 7.1. Course assessment
Type of Assessment | CLOs | Assessment criteria | Proportion (%)
[1] | [4] | [5] | [6]
Class Participation | CLO1.1 -> CLO3.2 | Evaluating participation of students at class, learning attitude and teamwork | 10%
Mid-term | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 | Individual test | 20%
Group Project | CLO1.1 -> CLO3.2 | Group presentation and slide print out | 20%
Final Exam | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 | Will be defined depend on regulations | 50%
8. LESSON PLAN
Table 8.1. Lesson Plaan
Session/Week | Content | CLOs | Assessment
[1] | [2] | [4] | [6]
1 | Chapter 1. Introduction 1.1 Knowledge discovery and data mining 1.2 Knowledge discovery and data mining Process 1.3 Type of data sets 1.4 KDD applications 1.5 KDD challenges | CLO1.1 CLO2.1 CLO3.2 | Participation
2 | Chapter 2. Getting to Know Your Data 2.1 Data Objects and Attribute Types 2.2 Basic Statistical Descriptions of Data 2.3 Data Visualization 2.4 Measuring Data Similarity and Dissimilarity | CLO1.1 CLO2.1 CLO3.2 | Participation
3-4 | Chapter 3. Data Preprocessing 2.1 Data Cleaning 2.2 Data Integration 2.3 Data Reduction 2.4 Data Transformation and Data Discretization | CLO1.1 CLO2.1 | Participation Personal exercises
5-6 | Chapter 4. Mining Frequent Patterns, Associations, and Correlations: Basic
Concepts and Methods 2.1 Basic Concepts 2.2 Frequent Itemset Mining Methods 2.3 Which Patterns Are Interesting? Pattern  evaluation Methods 2.4 Advanced Pattern Mining | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 CLO3.1 CLO3.2 | Participation Personal exercises
7-8 | Chapter 5. Classification and prediction 2.1 Basic Concepts 2.2 Decision Tree Induction 2.3 Lazy Learners 2.4 Model Evaluation and Selection 5.5 Other Methods | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 CLO3.1 CLO3.2 | Participation Personal exercises
9-11 | Chapter 6. Cluster Analysis 2.1 Cluster Analysis 2.2 Partitioning Methods 2.3 Hierarchical Methods 2.4 Evaluation of Clustering 6.5 Other methods 6.6 Outlier Detection | CLO2.1 CLO2.2 CLO3.1 CLO3.2 | Participation Personal exercises
12 | Chapter 7. Data Mining Trends and Research Frontiers 2.1 Mining Complex Data Types 2.2 Other Methodologies of Data Mining 2.3 Data Mining Applications 2.4 Data Mining and Society 6.5 Data Mining Trends | CLO1.1 CLO1.2 CLO3.1 CLO3.2 | Participation Personal exercises
13-14 | Group project | CLO1.1 -> CLO3.2 | Participation Group presentation
15 | Course review | - | Participation Group presentation
9. COURSE REQUIREMENTS AND EXPECTATION
9.1. Attendance Requirements
- Students are required to fully take part in class lectures and activities.
- Students are allowed to be absent maximum 10% of the class hours. Students who is absent over 10% is not qualified to take the final exam.
9.2. In-class Behavior Requirements
- The course is carried out with respect to both lecturer and students. All behavior that might adversely affect the stakeholders are prohibited.
- Students need to be in class on time. Students being late for more than 10 minutes will not be eligible to take part in the session.
- Cellphone, laptop, tablet are only accepted for the purposes of taking notes of the lectures, preparing course assignments, not for anyother entertainment purposes while in class duration.
INSTITUTE OF ADVANCED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS | DEPARTMENT | LECTURER
